subject: Economics
title: Moral Hazard: When Insurance Makes You Reckless
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Moral Hazard: When Insurance Makes You Reckless.

hook.text: People with car insurance drive less carefully than uninsured drivers.

buildup.text: Moral hazard: when someone is protected from risk, they take bigger risks. The safety net becomes a trampoline.

discovery.text: Insured homeowners are less likely to install fire alarms. Bailed-out banks take bigger bets. The pattern is universal.

twist.text: Deductibles exist specifically to counter moral hazard.

climax.text: Moral hazard is why complete protection is dangerous. A little skin in the game keeps people responsible.

punchline.text: The safest feeling is often the most dangerous one.

quiz.question: Why do insurance companies use deductibles?
options: To reduce moral hazard by ensuring policyholders still bear some cost of risky behavior
